data.title: Barbara Robinson Service Details - Ottawa, Ontario
data.meta_description: Barbara passed away peacefully on Tuesday, January 19, 2016, with her family by her side at the Ottawa General Hospital. She was a loving wife to Doug and cherished mother to Gordon (Stephanie), Peter (Melissa) and Sarah (Derek). She was a devoted grandmother to Aiden, Jack and Drew. She is also survived by a sister Patricia (John) of Toronto and by many nieces and nephews. Her brothers Robert (Anne) and Ian predeceased her. Barbara was born in Simcoe, Ontario on September 30, 1939, the daughter of Perry Mackay and Agnes Madeleine Simson. She graduated with a B.A. from Waterloo Lutheran (Waterloo niversity College) in 1962. Later she graduated with BLS and MLS degrees in Library Science from the University of Toronto where she met and married a classmate Doug. They lived in Peterborough for over ten years in the 1970s and then moved to Ottawa where they have lived for the last thirty-five years. Barbara was very much involved in her church, Rideau Park. She sang in the church choir for a number of years and was President of the UCW. She also served on a number of other church bodies such as session and council.  She enjoyed travelling, music and the NAC and the Shaw Festival. She worked for a number of years as an Educational Assistant in public schools in Ottawa. She was of a warm, gentle nature and will be missed by her family and her many friends. Family and friends are invited to visit at the Central Chapel of Hulse, Playfair & McGarry, 315 McLeod Street (at Oâ€™Connor) on Thursday, January 28 from 4-8 p.m. Funeral Service to be held at Rideau Park United Church, 2203 Alta Vista Drive (at Cunningham) on Friday, January 29 at 2 p.m. In lieu of flowers, please consider making a donation to Rideau Park United Church or The Canadian Cancer Society.
